Any more info what is not working.. installation.. game... and what part of it? does launcher menu appear? if it appear try different modes in advanced menu (window below java 6 /7 options) there are options for engine optimization for multi core processor/ single core....

if i hit continue i get the launcher but it does not work.

Do you have newest Microsoft frame network? try installing newest. and  what system you use XP /VISTA/ 7 ? on xp it may lag but should work. But truly i think you got 64 bit system.. and you need to launch 64 bit version of game.. and for this you should use ".bat" launchers.. from other versions of game.

Yes. the one you where using before. it should do the trick.

thx for the help.
start game and in username write your username :) simple as that. No registration nothing as such. and there is only one save per account so if you want new save change username.

I'm having the same problem that  kidlonewolf  was having. I have Windows 7 x64, and installed the latest .NET framework, and Java. I don't have the ".bat" launchers. Where/How can I get them?

i'm also having the microsoft .net issue. here is as detailed as I can get:

I installed Microsoft .NET v4.0
I get an error that says: "Unhandled exception has occurred in your application, if you click continue the application will ignore this error."
If I click continue, I get the launcher.
I've tried every possible combination of the launcher, java 6, java 7, windowed mode, full screen, etc. When you hit play, a cmd box opens and closes fast and the game never loads.
I tried downloading v0.2l from here and getting the .bat files. I tried the HD, High, Medium, & Low.bat files and none of them worked. They all said "could not locate file path Project Zomboid/PAUSE" please press any key to continue.

I've also tried running the launcher with compatibility of XP3 and no luck as well.

I really want to play this new version!

Also:

If I copy over the High/Medium/Low "2".bat from the v0.2l, the game will load, ask for my username/password, but regardless if I enter one or not, when I hit play offline a game window saying v0.2.0q Alpha pops up and is frozen without loading anything. Dang.

protoZor: Ah, yes. Must be nice to have money. Dear protoZor's mother, can I get an allowance too?

Anyone who can't get this to work, don't install it to program files, instead install it to a folder, e.g. My Documents or Desktop, where the launcher has access to read/write. Otherwise you'll keep getting the .NET error.

nevermind, can't get it to work either with Win 7 64-bit. However, I think megweg is just a moron. Should have included a BATCH file launcher instead of some garbage Visual Basic, can't program for shit because I can't avoid Null Reference Exceptions, nonsense. Fuck you megweg.

Okay! I calmed down. Here we go! This is a working BATCH file launcher and a working version of lwjgl (Because for some reason the one included is missing files). Just unzip this to your Project Zomboid 0.2.0q directory and run "Launcher.bat" although I have it set up to work with Java 6, you may have to tweak the batch file a bit. Hope this helps someone!!

http://bayfiles.com/file/b5Qb/EUZe2f/ProjectZomboidv020qFix.ZIP

Although, alternatively you can just use the BATCH launcher I included, and download lwjgl yourself if you'd rather not trust me. The batch is the most important part anyway.

I included the lwjgl files because the lwjgl.jar file included in this download was only 900KB, and kept showing the "ClassDefNotFound org/lwjgl/utils/Rectangle" error as it was missing class files.

Anyway, good luck!
